event.title: serves as the Glasscock County seat, and at the 2010

data.event: Garden City serves as the Glasscock County seat, and at the 2010 Census, had a population of 334.
Garden City's history began in 1886, when what became the town's post office was established in a general store, and a settlement began to develop in the area around the business.
In 1893, Glasscock County was organized, and Garden City vied for the county seat along with two other area communities, New California and Dixie.

event.title: relocated to the New California site, and on April 5, 1893

data.event: In a unique compromise, most of Garden City's structures were placed on wheels and relocated to the New California site, and on April 5, 1893, the settlement was renamed Garden City.

event.title: followed by a new, larger courthouse in 1910

data.event: A two-story stone courthouse was constructed later that same year, followed by a new, larger courthouse in 1910 (with the former building remaining in use as the Glasscock County Jail).
